Draconis, your excessively bleak future outlook is unfounded. The theory that we will run out of food doesn't make sense as there is more than enough food in the world to feed everyone as it stands today and it will remain that way. The reason there is hunger is because of poor distribution in some nations. The US, Europe, China, and India shouldn't have to deal with the masses starving unless their governments/system break down. They are all efficient enough to be able to coordinate and feed their people. Also note that the powers of the world are actually decreasing in population growth and if this trend continues their populations will actually begin to fall all over the world. In short the 1st world countries shouldn't have to worry about running out of food anytime soon.
 
 Furthermore the China v India theory probably wouldn't stand up. Russia has too many nukes to allow China or India to take them just as Japan has too many allies to fall without starting a world war. Pakistan and India would have a massive nuclear war if they ever had to do battle ending any hope that either could ever take over much after that war ended. MAD is enough to stop any one country from taking over a bunch of other countries ever again. Considering globalization as well, China and India would suffer economically if they wished to expand as they would be shunned by the West politically and economically.
